1.content:
Steven was walking home from school on a rainy day. Steven didn't have the best of days today. Benjamin (his best friend) and him hung out, sure. Steven heard all about Benjamin reading all the Harry Potter books back-to-back and the 24 season set Benjamin bought. But hearing a long tirade wasn't what was keeping him down.

Steven was still unnoticed by Jill, the head cheerleader. Sure he didn't have much of a chance with her, but he loved her. Then he failed a test. Then he got tons of homework. Now he's going home, and is sure his parents aren't there and he'll have to watch Rachel. For a 12 year old, she can be quite a handful.

As he walked home, to vent his frustration, he found a dumpster and punched it. That wasn't smart. It hurt. A lot. But something in the dumpster caught Steven's eye. A weird necklace.

Steven grabbed the necklace and wondered: Should he put it on? Or wait until he's home? Or just leave it there?

Steven put on the necklace, feeling like he had to put the necklace on...it was almost calling to him. Steven felt...at peace, for a lack of a better term, wearing it. All of a sudden, he felt like he could change anything. His head went blank and then he started to feel "normal" again.

Steven thought to himself that he should try to see if the feeling was real. He walked around the general area and saw a couple making out in an alley. To his surprise, it was Jill and her supposed boyfriend-of-the-week (Jill probably chose him because he was buff. REALLY buff.). She didn't notice him. Neither did the disposable boyfriend. He could try to change what was happening to the two of them.

Or he could change himself.

Decisions, decisions...

11111111.content:
Looking at Steven and smiling, she started adding muscles to her naked body. Steven reached forward to grab the necklace, but Jill had already grown much stronger than him and pushed him back toward a bookcase. He fell into it, knocking off a pile of comic books. He held onto the bookcase to keep himself from falling down. The comic books fell to the ground in front of Jill.

By this time Jill had already added enough muscle to put any boy in school to shame. Her legs were thick with muscle. Grapefruit sized calves jutted outward and her massive thighs hung over her small knees in perfect teardrops. Her narrow stomach was tensed into a cut 8-pack and her gravity defying tits pushed outward from a shelf of striated pectorals. Her muscle filled arms hung to the side, pressed outward by her wide back. She hadn’t grown much taller, having reached 6 foot tall, matching the height of Steven. “So, you like these things huh?”

Steven righted himself and stood there cautiously. He swallowed nervously as he started to sport some serious wood. It wasn’t every day a beautiful, fully naked muscle girl was in his room. OK, this had never happened before, but he certainly had dreamed about it. And before Steven could answer, she read his mind, surprised that she had that ability. Shaking her head, she grinned.

“You don’t need to answer. I can tell you do. And you know what? Having the power of this necklace is intoxicating. I don’t really want to be 15 feet high. But I do enjoy the thought of being powerful. Ruling the school is one thing. Ruling the planet, well that’s another. But I’m getting ahead of myself. What would you like to see Steven? Do you want to see me make your comic book world come to life and have me take on the strongest heroes and villains? Would you like to see me become Supergirl or the Invisible Girl? Or Supergirl or the Invisible Girl with massive muscles?”

Steven’s blood rushed out of his face. Holy cow! Someone he could tell the necklace had given her the ability to lock in his thoughts. And that she would grant his wildest dreams! Jill realized then, maybe she should change everyone in a different manner. Maybe work her way back or humans, or something else entirely.

Then again, maybe the necklace was drained or something? It was one thing to change the world the way the Joker had, but to do it several times in the course of a such short time might have been too much, even for this mighty artifact. So maybe try a smaller change, perhaps on just herself?

11111112111112.title: Jill wants to make things even stranger

111111121111121.content:
Jill brought the werewolves from another part of this Interactive Story, into this storyline. Except now she made them have bright red noses, and white fur with BIG smiles. Jill tamed them, played with them... and then set them loose on "innocent" civilians. Or as they were now simply called, "Clowns".

Jill laughed with delight as she watched the werewolves attack en masse. Everyone did. As people were being torn to shreds, all they could do is laugh, even while being bitten or torn apart. Some werewolves decided to be peoples' pets though. So Jill merged them together, making them "anthros", combinations of humans and werewolves. Anthros sounded funny. Jill spelt it out, looking like an inncoent child while doing so. And while making bad things happen.

"A is for ants."
Ants flooded the streets, and the clowns loved bathing in them.
"N is for nonsense."
All language was rendered useless briefly as no one could understand words anymore. This only served to make everyone say the silliest things possible, knowing no one could understand them. When they could understand each other, they all started killing each other again.
"T is for toys."
Toys rained down on the streets, in devestating effect. Toy soldiers shot real bullet, bouncing balls broke buildings and people gained Super Soakers that shot acid. Even more chaos broke out.
"H is for heat."
The cities of the world became hot until volcanic eruptions happened and soaked people in lava...made of food colouring and syrup! But heated a lot to burn through flesh.
"R is for robots."
Giant robots began battling across the world, until they decided to gang up on people and eat them.
"O is for octopus."
Octopus tentacles began growing out of people's mouths and strangling them as they smiled.
"S is for...for...stupidity!"
Everyone's IQ dropped down 75 points. Except for those reading this. They only lost 100 points! April Fool's! If today is April. Isn't April like the first month? For that matter, what's a month?


The Anthros were bad enough, but now everyone was stupid. er. And laughing all the way, they either killed themselves out of stupidity or killed each other.

Jill liked this world. But she needed another name. Jill was so...5 seconds ago. Jill the Jester! That had a good ring to it.


So Jill the Jester continued causing chaos until she had a naughty thought. Why not go to the beginning of the story again (before the necklace caused chaos), as Jill the Jester and drive an alternate timeline batty? Hmm...for some reason, clowns didn't like bats. ...Or she could stay here. Life is fun here, but death is better!

What does she do?
111111121111121.title: Werewolf cheerleaders for the win!

choices: Make everyone in the world moronic clowns except for Jill.
Make everyone in the world murderous clowns except for Jill.
1111111211111211.content:
In a "normal" day on a "normal" world, a "normal" Jill was having her birthday. On a boat. A cruise ship. On a school weekend. She was that rich and cool.

But it was kind of boring. She had sex with everyone she wanted to, and then some. She got drunk fifty times over. She did everything teenagers AREN'T supposed to do to death. She felt she could go insane with boredom.


Then again, she didn't really understand death or insanity. But in another timeline, she did. In that timeline, she became Jill the Jester and screwed the world up really good with the help of the Joker. Good times. Times she would never know of. Until Jill the Jester magically appeared on the boat.


A bunch of teenagers saw her come around a corner. One teenager said, "What's with the clown makeup, Jill? You high?" Jill the Jester replied, "No, but you are." With a clap of his hands, he started laughing and never stopped. As he rose through the air in a never ending ascent. Still laughing.

But the teenagers weren't. As Jill the Jester fiddled with the necklace, they all started giggling. And beating each other up. Or having sex. Or both. The end result would be them killing themselves in pleasure, so that was good enough.

As Jill the Jester made her way through the boat, more random things happened to the other innocent teenagers. Food starting eating people. The boat flipped upside down, but gravity kept them on the boat. Sharks with smiles jumped up (or down, depending on how you look at it) and swallowed people whole while they laughed. Beautiful girls became mermaids. Boys became "mermen", with the heads of fish and lower parts being male.

Everything went crazy and everyone loved it. For the finishing touch, everyone left living on the boat became a laughing maniac, a clown and one of the Jill the Jester's servants...all at once. Except Jill.


Jill witnessed some of this and hid the whole time. But Jill the Jester wanted Jill to loosen up and have fun. So she decided to do something special for Jill's birthday and prove to Jill she wasn't bad. She was going to show Jill what her home was like. And then her and Jill could go for a girl's night out, in which she'd drive Jill to insanity to be worthy of ruling over her world (to be made insane before her rule, during said night out).

Jill was scared as Jill the Jester came out of nowhere and decided to:
1111111211111211.title: Go screw up another timeline.

choices: Steven tells her that he gave it to her and....
Steven has no idea what she is talking about and....
11111112111112111.content:
Jill felt something slimy and wet on her face. Was jester licking her?

Jill sat up with a start and looked around her bedroom. It was only a dream, Jill thought. Her hand immediately went to her neck and felt the cold metal around her neck.

"OMG! What the hell!"

Jumping out of bed, Jill ran to the window and looked out at the bright sunshine and the calm, serene scene of the neighborhood in which she had always lived. Nothing looked out of place, no clowns were romping around causing havoc.
She reached down and unclasped the necklace and looked closely at it. It resembled the necklace in her dream, but how could it be? She tried to remember the details of what.... the dream? She remembered it was Steven who had first given her the necklace. She had to call him!

As she dialed the phone, she looked at her nails and thought about what color she would paint them next, french tips always looked.....


"Steven!' she screamed into the phone, Do you know anything about a necklace?
11111112111112111.title: Make everyone in the world moronic clowns excep...

choices: She went on the carnival bus.
1111111211112.content:
As the world was turning back to normal, Joker pulled off one last trick before he became nothing more than fiction again. He grabbed the necklace and broke it, then threw the broken necklace into a nearby sewer grate.

Jill was worried about this, then collapsed. Waking up, she found everything was back to normal. Except her! She was still a clown. She was herself...just not physically. She was permanently a clown...unless she could get the necklace and get it fixed.

But to do that, she'd have to go in the sewers. And the sewers apparently had alligators AND crocodiles down there. Could be an urban myth... But should she take the chance?

Then again, a carnival-themed bus was riding by...she could probably hitch a ride to where it was going (presumably a carnival).

What did Jill do?
1111111211112.title: Turn everything back to normal...this world is ...

11111112111122.content:
Going on the carnival bus, she predictably ended up in a carnival. Far away from the broken necklace to never be found. Kids loved looking at her. People stared at her. It was awkward.

But then Jill found she was really good at juggling for some reason. Why? She didn't know, but she decided to join the carnival after a week. She had nothing better to do.

Jill the Clown became an attraction that everyone loved. And in time, her heart warmed up to it and she enjoyed making kids laugh. But, sadly, with the necklace gone; she was stuck a clown forever. Sometimes, she wondered what life would be like if she actually decided to go in the sewers and get the necklace.

Though she grew to enjoy being a clown, the necklace was gone and so the story comes to an end.
11111112111122.title: She went on the carnival bus.

choices: Jill is able to fight off her urge to do good
Jill realizes that the Joker did something to her
111111121112.content:
Meanwhile Jill (as Wonder Woman) had realized the necklace was missing, she suddenly felt very disoriented and confused. She could see that she was shrinking and her muscles were getting smaller. Quickly she in front of a store window in an attempt to see what just happened to her.

She could see that she must have lost about a foot in height and guessed she was now only about 5 feet tall. All of her feminine muscle mass appeared to have disappeared as well, leaving her quite petite. Her breasts were apparently the same size now looking absolutely mammoth on her much smaller frame. Her rear end was also about the same size as before. Her face also remained just as pretty as before.

She realized that she must find The Joker and take back the necklace, but for some reason she had an overwhelming urge to knock off a liquor store. No she thought to herself, robbing a store is wrong and she only does good with her superpowers. Jill got even more confused as she remembered (as a result of Joker's wish) that she didn't really have any superpowers. She just used her good looks and small stature to coax men into helping her do whatever she wanted them to do.

Jill fought hard to fight this conflicting emotion of wanting to help people. She needed money and why shouldn't she get the way she always does, by finding some suckers to rob a store for her?
111111121112.title: Made the whole world a parody of everything.

choices: She sees Joker laughing at Stupid Man and realizes what he did
Jill continues to look for suckers to rob a store for her
1111111211121.content:
Jill knows that she needs some money and the best way to do it is to rob a liquor store. As she heads down the street to trick some men into doing the job for her, she notices a handsome man in a blue suit with a cape trying (without much success) to rob a parking meter.

She stops and takes a better look at him. She really becomes confused when she feels peaceful seeing Superman, because her and Superman are old friends. She then thinks to herself that there is no such thing as Superman. She recognizes this guy as Stupid Man, a complete loser who spends more time in jail then he does trying to commit crimes.

She stops and watches him as cop car pulls up to him and asks what he is doing. She can't believe the answer he gives the cops "I'm trying to steal from this stupid machine, but I can't figure out how to break it open." The cops just start laughing at him, and he starts laughing with them. One cop asks "So if you succeed, are you going to share the money with us?"

Stupid Man replies "No, the money is all mine!" The cop says, "Well we need to arrest you then."

Stupid Man doesn't even put up a fight as he is arrested. One of the other cops hits the parking meter real hard with his baton and pockets all of the coins that fall out. He turns to Stupid Man and says "See, crime does pay if you are smart enough!"

One of the other cops says "Hey Jim, are you going to share the money with us?".

"No, rob some other parking meter moron".

The other cop pulls out his gun and shoots at the first cop. Within a minute the two cops are having an all out gun battle with each other.

Stupid Man has the perfect opportunity to escape, but he is too stupid to recognize it and just sits there sulking that he is going back to jail for the 6th time this year.

While watching this Jill knows something is wrong.
1111111211121.title: Jill is able to fight off her urge to do good

choices: Give her something to keep her mind off of her current predicament.
Turn her back to normal or keep her this way (choose which one).
111111122.content:
Jill felt herself shrinking. Her clothes weren't fitting anymore. Even Jill's figure was reverting to some smaller figure.

Jill ran on a sidealk, wondering what was going on, freaked out of her mind. She was looking for someone to tell her what was going on. Her voice sounded younger as she screamed for help.

A parked car nearby provided answers. She looked into it's side mirror and realized...she was 8 years old.

Jill's mind then started to regress to an 8 year old's as she began crying her eyes out. Looking at the necklace, she thought two things. One, she wanted something, anything to keep her mind off of this. Or two, better yet, turn her back to normal! Then again...being 8 couldn't be too bad, right? She was unsure if it was right to feel unsure about that.

The necklace decided to:
111111122.title: a kid again. Jill is now 8 years old.

choices: Choose between pirates and the Wild West.
1111111221.content:
All of a sudden, a library appeared out of nowhere. Jill's mind was almost fully regressed now. She never even knew she was once nearly an adult.

Jill happily ran into the library, due to her love of reading when younger...though, she didn't remember she was ever older than 8.

In the library, she grabbed two books to read. She didn't even care which ones.

She got to reading, unaware that the necklace could screw her over...again.

The two books were one about pirates (with someone who looked like infamous pirate Jack Sparrow on its coer) and one about cowboys and cowgirls. Her mind got to work thinking about the two. The necklace would either let her stay this way, or make the whole world like "Pirate Times" or "Wild West Times". What happened?
1111111221.title: Give her something to keep her mind off of her ...

choices: Let's go to the Wild West!
11111112212.content: Is the world reverting to the Wild West? Or is it a pirate's paradise?
11111112212.title: Choose between pirates and the Wild West.

choices: Jill the Kid it is. Let's ride!
Let's fix this somehow. Being an outlaw is NEVER good.
111111122121.content:
Poor Jill started to feel woozy...and then collapsed unconcious.

Waking up slowly, she noted the saloons around her. The twin revolvers in her hands. She seemed to be the age she was when this all started, and remembered everything again. And she was in a cowgirl outfit, beside apparently her horse.

"What the hell is going on?" was her first thought in this scenario.

She looked at the abandoned area. She called out, "Is anyone here?" And then her gang rode in on their horses. One gang member said, "You called, Jill?" Jill responded in confusion, "Uh...yeah. What's going on?"

The member of her gang replied, "Don't we have a heist of a gold revolver with diamonds in it? Yeah, that revovler is worth a fortune." Jill looked at her revovlers and said, "But I already have revolvers." Her gang laughed, one saying, "Boss, you're always so funny. Pretending you don't know what's going on...then BANG! Your enemies realize you know what's going on, hell, you're in control. ...But seriously, we gotta ride if we're gonna get that revolver."

Jill let a loose giggle, which for some reason briefly curved into a smile.

Jill then realized the necklace was still on her. She took it off (just in case) and shoved it in her pocket.

Looking around, she saw a "Most Wanted" poster. It said, "The most notorious outlaw in the West is on the loose. To citizens, look out for her. Jill the Kid is armed and dangerous."

Jill couldn't help but giggle. Somehow she must have replaced Billy the Kid. It was kind of funny thinking about it.

She then thought, "Should I try to fix this with the necklace?" Then she thought, "Or should I just have fun? ...I can't believe I'm thinking this could be fun..."
111111122121.title: Let's go to the Wild West!

choices: Jill is now 8 years old...and loves it!
Jill wants to be "normal" and so she is.
1111111222.content: So, what happens to Jill? Is she an 8 year old and loves it? Or does she go back to normal?
1111111222.title: Turn her back to normal or keep her this way?

choices: "You're big and strong..." Jill says to Steven.
"You're really smart..." Jill says to Steven.
11111112222.content:
Jill suddenly thought about her and Steven, and she panicked.

“Oh wow… I want to be with Steven… I want to be normal again… I want to be with Steven and I want for both of us to be normal again!” she said out loud.

Suddenly, there was a flash of light. When Jill opened her eyes, she was in bed, in her own bedroom, and Steven was on her bed, right next to her.

“Steve! Steve!” she said, as she shook him awake by the shoulders. “Wake up, Steve!”

“Hmmm?” he said groggily.

“We’re back! We’re at my house!” she cheered.

Steve looked up and smiled. He noticed that Jill still had the necklace hanging around her neck.

“Thanks, Jill. You saved the day once again…” he whispered to her.

“Oh, honey… I wouldn’t want to spend the day with anyone else but you!” she smiled, as she laid down next to him.

“Oh, come on! What do you like about me?” he sighed. “I’m just an average guy…”

Jill just smiled as she stared at him.
11111112222.title: Jill wants to be "normal" and so she is.

choices: I wish you were as strong as me...
I wish you and I were together...forever...
111111122221.content:
"You're big and strong..." Jill said with a lustful tone.

Steven shook his head subtly, wondering what Jill meant. All of a sudden, due to the necklace around Jill's neck, Steven felt a tingling feeling. The feeling went through his entire body. His muscles grew huger and huger. His biceps grew to bodybuilder size, as veins popped up all over them. His triceps grew as his abs became rock solid. His overall weight shot upwards, except it was all muscle. Steven felt like he could lift anything. He felt powerful...but wanted more. He wanted Jill. He caressed her necklace and said something, which the necklace would react to and change everything yet again. He said:
111111122221.title: "You're big and strong..." Jill say...

1111112.content:
Jill grabbed some clothes, dressed herself and left. She was disgusted at what happened. And she definitley didn't want to test the necklace, if that was what made her into a monster.

Meanwhile, Steven went from unconcious to merely sleeping. A good change, but somehow in his sleep, he put the necklace back on. The necklace willed him to do it.

And then the necklace changed everything to match his dream. Was it a good dream? Or a nightmare?
1111112.title: Jill leaves without the necklace.

choices: The world became very happy, because if you're not...bad things happen.
Every time he sleeps, he gets a new great life.
11111121.content:
In this good dream, Steven had a dream of a normal life. Life like it was before the necklace changed everything. Then it became more "ideal". Jill was his girlfriend (again), he was a buff popular student (again) and he was happy having the necklace.

Did he really learn anything from his experiences? Probably not.

Then the dream went further. His parents were actually home a lot. His sister never behaved badly. He felt it wasn't fair that only he should be happy. So now, everyone in the world was ALWAYS happy. There was even world peace. Still, if you weren't happy...you were either forced to be happy or bad things happened.

Kind of scared to continue in that dream (What were these bad things?), he had another dream. In this dream, he found that he woke up every time he slept to a new life. A good life. Maybe he was a billionaire (Money is always good). Maybe he was in the body of a supermodel (Checking himself out while he's a hot woman? Priceless to him). Who knows? All he knew was that sleeping was always a good way to start another amazing day.

...So, which dream came true, thanks to the necklace?
11111121.title: It was a good dream.

111111211.content:
Steven woke up to another great day. He flexed his giant muscles again and looked at his framed picture beside his bed of him and his girlfriend, Jill. Rachel came running to his room and hugged him. His parents were making pancakes for breakfast.

Wait a second. Steven thought to himself, "What's happening? Last time I was buff, bad things followed. And this picture of Jill and me...how the hell did I get that? Last time she liked me, things didn't go so well either. Maybe I should use the necklace again..."

Before he could, his parents brought him breakfast in bed. A ton of pancakes. With syrup. And they smelled so good. Steven chowed down and decided to wait a little while longer before using the necklace. Just in case, he took it off.

Still, the only new weird thing that really bothered him was the fact that his parents and Rachel were smiling. Big smiles. Insanely big smiles. And they never stopped smiling.


Upon changing into clothes (he was surprised he even had clothes that fit him), he put the necklace in his pocket. All of a sudden, he heard a ring on his nearby cell phone. Picking it up, it was Jill. Jill gushed on about how much she loved him and asked if their date at the movies was still on. Steven said that it was, but first made sure what theatre it was at. Still, why was their date in half an hour? He just woke up.

The theatre was near his house so he could walk there. Along the way, everyone was happy. REALLY happy. It was kind of creepy.

Upon reaching the theatre, Jill jumped out of nowhere on him (bad memories came up). But she was also really happy. It was like someone put a permanent smile on her face. Steven then asked her why everyone was so happy.


Jill responded almost puzzled (but still smiling), "Because everyone is always happy. If you're not, they come get you and make you happy. You're not smiling though...are you alright? ...I could get them for you." Steven, slightly scared, said "No...that's alright, I'm happy."

Jill looked at Steven and said, "But you're not smiling. You're not happy enough. Our date can happen later, you need help." Jill then yelled out, "Someone's not happy!"


Steven was puzzled at why she would yell this out. Then a tranquilizer dart hit him, seemingly coming out of nowhere. And he fell asleep.


Steven woke up, to find himself locked in a cell and chained up in some sort of cross between a torture chamber and a high tech lab. Steven, still waking up, barely managed to say, "What's going on?"

A woman in a lab coat (who was smiling ear-to-ear) came and said, "We took you because you weren't happy. Would you like to be tortured until you're happy or injected until you're happy?"

Steven thought both choices were probably not good. But where was the necklace? Steven asked, "Where's my necklace?"

The woman replied, "We took it from you and are analyzing it in the next room. But first, we need to make you happy." The woman pulled an axe and a syringe out of nowhere, still smiling. The woman said, "Answer my question, please."


Sadly, Steven realized he had no choice...but if he chose one, she'd have to open the cell. Maybe then he could escape?

So what does Steven choose?
111111211.title: The world became very happy, because if you'...

choices: Rachel. Rachel is an evil angel?!?
Jill. Jill is an evil angel?!? Wait, that one is sort of easy to believe...
1111112111.content:
Steven said, "Okay, okay. Umm...torture, please?" The woman opened the cell, still smiling as she brushed the axe VERY close to Steven's face. Steven wondered if he should scream for help, then realized it wouldn't do much good in a place like this.

The woman said, "I want you to know the pain will be unbearable, unless you remember it will make you happy. Shall we begin?" Steven felt that "pain" and "happy" contradict each other.


The woman brought the axe close to Steven's face again. But if he wiggled around, he might be able to have the restraints cut by the nearby blade. Then again, he didn't have much of a choice.

Steven shook for dear life. And, luckily, for Steven...the axe cut the chains. Almost miracously, he managed to shake off the chains. The woman then came running at him with the axe as he ran. And didn't look back.


Ditching the madwoman by hiding behind torture equipment, he heard some people talking nearby. He followed the noise down a hallway, filled with paintings of bloody smiley faces. Creepy.

The noise came from inside a small room. The door was slightly ajar. He tried to take a peek in, but couldn't see who the people were. There was a male voice and a female voice though.

"Has he settled down?"
"No, madame, he hasn't. Though he is in re-education as we speak."
"Well, call me when he's back to normal. I do know him."
"Of course, madame."
"Smile bigger."
"Is this satisfactory?"
"For now."
"Why do we always have to smile?"
"Are we questioning the will of God?"
"...No."
"Good. Because God was reincarnated in our chosen. We owe it to God to respect the body that God lays in. And that body desires happiness."
"And control."
"Maybe I should tell her. I am her Angel of Bliss. And I'm sure she'd want you strapped down too. She only pretends to be normal, you know that right?"
"...Of course."
"Good. I'm leaving."

Another door (apparently from inside the room that Steven was outside of) was heard opening and closing. Steven realized those voices...one sounded familiar. The female one, the "Angel of Bliss". The voice belonged to...
1111112111.title: Torture, please...

choices: Freddy and Jason came to town.
11111122.content:
Steven should never have watched all those horror movies he enjoyed. Visions of Jason from Friday the 13th and Freddy from Nightmare on Elm Street danced through his head. Then his dreams shifted to everyone in his city being vampires...but him, as he desperatley tried to escape the city.

The necklace made sure:
11111122.title: It was a nightmare.

choices: "I'm a vampire that can exist in daylight. Pretty cool, huh?"
"I can exist in the day, but that's because I'm the vampire Queen."
111111222.content:
Steven felt faint. Then he watched as the world around him reassembled into a blood bank. Creepy.

And as for the slightly pale staff walking towards him slowly, licking their razor sharp pointed teeth...creepier.

One said, "His blood will be delicious..."

Wait a minute. Blood bank? Pale people with razor sharp teeth? Come on! They can't be...

Another said, "I love being a vampire. I'm sure he will too. Won't you?"


Steven slapped his head, and was about to wish he never even heard of vampires, when suddenly stakes went flying through all the vampires killing them. They came crashing through a window, showing the night sky. Almost like someone was sniping with stakes.


A door bust wide open and out stepped...Jill? Jill said, "I gotta get you out of here. We're evacuating the city, since so few of us are left alive." Steven said quietly in disbelief, "This can't be Jill..."

Jill replied, "Yeah, it's me Jill the vampire slayer. Who were you expecting? Buffy? Because she's just a TV character." Steven rolled his eyes.

Steven decided to leave with Jill. She might keep him safe. And the necklace isn't the best thing to use. Then again, Jill seemed to be prone to...changes. That and she...well, he couldn't finger it but he got the impression she had done a lot of bad things. Like every choice someone makes ends with her screwing them over.


As the two left into the night, Jill and Steven boarded her motorcycle and rode enough into the night. Steven kept the necklace in a pocket. Did not want it to screw him over. Again.

Vampires attacked and Jill used a machine gun with one hand to mow them down. Jill then stopped in an abandoned hospital, and starting itching the back of her neck.

Jill got off and so did Steven. Steven said, "Why are we stopping? We have to get out of here. Now."


Jill brushed aside her hair and showed Steven numerous bite marks on her neck. Steven said, "Oh no, please no." Jill responded, "Bet you wish Buffy was real now." Steven backed off as Jill said, "You should know, that I'm not just any vampire. It's an honour to be bitten by me because..."
111111222.title: Everyone (but Steven) became vampires!

choices: Yes, Steven loves being a vampire.
No, Steven hates being a vampire.
1111112222.content:
Upon saying, "It's an honour to be bitten by me because I can exist in the day, but that's because I'm the vampire Queen", Steven was scared. Very scared.

Jill then showed off her fangs and started licking them. Jill said to Steven, "You know, I know all about your little necklace. And I know it could stop me from fulfilling my plans to turn the world into vampires." Steven said, "Oh, so you want to take over the world?" Jill responded, "Yes, and it seems that your necklace could stop me. After all, after looking at the "Story Outline", it seems I have attempted a world takeover before...and I'm not going to let you or the necklace stop me this time."

Steven seemed puzzled, and Jill then said, "Have you ever been on Writing.com?" Steven shook his head. Jill said, "Breaking the fourth wall is wasted on you. But a bite isn't. Pucker up."


Before Steven could react, Jill sent her fangs into Steven's throat and sucked out a massive amount of blood. Steven fell unconcious, as Jill took the necklace and rode off, saying, "Sucker."


Steven woke up a few minutes later, now fully a vampire and without his necklace (since Jill now had it). Steven realized he needed to get the necklace back, but is he satisfied being a vampire?
1111112222.title: "I can exist in the day, but that's bec...

choices: His school, and there are some familiar faces there...and maybe a necklace.
His house, where Rachel is hiding from the vampires...and she has a necklace.
11111122221.content:
Steven felt somewhat groggy. But that feeling was replaced with bloodlust and a new need to serve his Queen, Queen Jill of the Vampires. He knew his Queen would want him to find any humans...and convert them to their cause.

Steven pondered over how miserable, pathetic humans were now scarce in his town. But he decided he should check in on some old "haunts", and maybe he'd find some fresh blood there. Blood...mmmm...tasty.

Steven began going towards his location, wanting four things:

1- Blood
2- To please Jill
3- To get another necklace
4- More blood

He arrived at his location. It was...
11111122221.title: Yes, Steven loves being a vampire.

choices: An epic fight scene takes place.
111111222211.content:
Steven burst into his school, wanting nothing more than to taste warm blood gushing into his mouth. However, when he arrived, the remaining humans were ready. They had numerous stakes and garlic, and even holy water.

Steven slowly backed off, not sure if he could take their arsenal. Then he noticed who they were...

There was Benjamin (his best friend), Karen (a cheerleader from other storylines), April (the high school version from some storylines) and Robert (the school jock from other storylines). How did all these characters appear in the high school? Well, they all were in his high school, so despite the possible continuity errors, he accepted the situation. ...But why did Benjamin have a necklace?

The four heroes picked up stakes and Steven unleashed his fangs.

The two forces went at it. And...
111111222211.title: His school, and there are some familiar faces t...

1111112222112.content:
Benjamin, who was holding a necklace, wished for the fighting to stop. He wished that the vampire Steven would freeze, and no one would have to die right now. Steven literally froze, being turned into a block of ice.

Benjamin then realized the power he had. The necklace attempted to corrupt him with it. Does he succumb to the temptations of the necklace?
1111112222112.title: Benjamin's necklace changes things...

11111122221121.content:
Benjamin felt the necklace's power surge through him. He could do anything, couldn't he? Laughing maniacally, he used the necklace for his own personal gains. First, he made the whole world obsessed with him. They would do what he wanted, when he wanted.

“Come on Hulk. Is this the best you can do? Show me your geometrically increasing strength! Show me those monster muscles! Drive me into the ground if you can! After all, I’m just a teen-age girl! And you’re the Incredible Hulk!”

The Hulk roared. “Bah! Stupid girl make fun of Hulk! The Hulk is the strongest one there is! And the madder the Hulk gets, the stronger the Hulk gets!”

And he pushed even harder! But Jill only smiled wider as her entire body began to glow.

“Ha! You call that strength? I’ll show you some real girl strength!”

Cosmic power began to pore into Jill’s muscles, DOUBLING her strength every second! Within moments, Jill pulled her leg up and was standing back up! Then she began to extend her arms back out, pushing the Hulk back! Now laughing, Jill twisted her wrists forward and bending the Hulk’s wrists back. She tightened her grip with her small fingers around his fists, slowly crushing his bones! The Hulk roared again, this time with pain!

“What’s the matter Hulk? Can’t you take it when the tables are turned? You dared to challenge me in a test of strength? I’m beyond super powered!”

Jill then tensed her gigantic muscles and her strength doubled AGAIN, blasting into her muscles like a nuclear explosion! She pressed harder, crushing the Hulk’s fists and sending him to his knees before her! Jill looked into the pain racked eyes of the formerly unstoppable monster as she continued to grow stronger and stronger! Her entire body was flexed to ridiculous proportions. Her skin was paper thin as every muscle on her body expanded out bigger until she was matching those of the Incredible Hulk. Muscles so big they ate up all space available on her frame. But they weren’t nearly big enough or strong enough for her! Wave after wave of increasing strength swept her body and in order to accommodate the muscles she demanded her height increased. At 7 feet tall her muscles grew bigger than the Hulk! At 8 feet tall, they dwarfed his!

“This is what real strength is all about, you pathetic loser! I’m the strongest one on this plant and I don’t care who shows up to challenge me! I’ll kick all of your asses!”

Pressing all of her godlike strength down, Jill drove the Hulk into the ground, smashing his body into the earth and onto his back with his legs twisted awkwardly below him. Jill stood over him and bent down, flexing her humongous muscles into the biggest, strongest most muscular pose ever dreamed and roaring with victory.

Her muscles expanded in every direction, filling up her now 9 foot tall body to the limit! Biceps 120 inches around surged forward, pectorals and boobs bigger than beech balls exploded forth as six inch thick striations raced across her mighty chest! Her shoulders and traps lept up to her ears! Her back was 8 feet wide and two feet thick! Her legs were as big around as 100 foot tall oak trees!

“Jill is the biggest one there is! Jill is the strongest one there is!”

The Hulk shook his head and pulled himself up, blinded by rage. Ignoring the fact that he now had to look up to see the powerful and beautiful girl before him. He pulled his fist back, ignoring the pain in his broken, but quickly healing, hands!

“Bah! Hulk heard it all before! Now Hulk SMASH!”

Soon a maid came through, followed by the cook from earlier with a plate of her favorite foods, breakfast or otherwise.

The four carriers took a step back, but seemed to be like guards though. That would be understandable. She might be loved the world over, but there would have to be many who might want her for themselves. As she ate her breakfast, she thought about her situation. Was she just only loved, but the world still ran on it's own, or did all those people who loved her, put her in charge of everything?

Also, she was beautiful by normal and regular standards, she hadn't earned her old cheerleading spot for no reason of course. Reading her thoughts, the necklace...

Ares, Artemis, Aphrodite, Apollo, Athena, Demeter, Hades, Hera, Hermes, Hephaestus, Poseidon, Aether, Gaia, Hemera, Nyx, Chaos, Oranos, Eros, Hebe, Hecate, Helios, Herakles, Hestia, Iris, Selene, Pan, and Nike."

"Wow...the Greek Pantheon!" Jill exclaimed, seeing all these deities in front of her.

"Well, you do recognize us then. So can we have this universe or not?" Zeus went on.
"Honey, leave the lady alone. We'll find another universe eventually." said Hera, placing a hand on her husband's shoulder.
"I...I know. I would just want my father to be proud of me as a God." said Zeus, slumping his shoulders.
"Dear, you locked him behind adamantine doors for all eternity. You've got nothing to try and prove. Most sons can never beat their fathers at anything, yet you did it with the help of Poseidon and Hades."

"I....hate to interupt, but umm...why don't you just create a new universe?" Jill asked.

But now Jill had that same thing to do. She could make her universe as big, or as small as she wanted. How though? What should it be for? Who should be in it? Does she want a single sentient species, or many different ones? Should she want to be worshipped? Or maybe the universe should be happy and perfect? But that was also boring. Maybe she should live amongst her creations, and have her every whim satisfied by her near-fanatical worshippers? Maybe she would create her own pantheon of minor-gods, to help take some of the stress off of her.

Stephanie walked to the front of the cafeteria. Clearing her throat, people looked at her, some looking at how pretty she was, some wondering if she was going to give a speech or something. Samantha walked back in as everyone exclaimed, "YES, QUEEN STEPHANIE!"

My necklace informs me that she plans to dominate the world with her necklace...how...cliche. I merely want to have as much fun as possible, and if I'm dominated, I can't have that, can I?"

Samantha thought about a movie she once saw, with an epic duel...it was a spaghetti western...and somehow (due to the necklace), both her and Karen had dual revolvers in their hands.

1112311222.content:
As the bell rang, Mr. Lombard dramatically pulled up the map that was covering the whiteboard at the front of the classroom, revealing the essay questions for the test. Stephanie briefly panicked, but then she saw a flash from her neck, and suddenly felt calmer -- she hadn't made a literal wish, but the necklace had filled her brain with the knowledge needed to ace the test.

But Mr. Lombard glared at her, then took the few steps over to her desk and held his hand out. "You know the rules, Stephanie."

She looked up from the paper where she had already started writing her first answer. "What?"

"Nothing is allowed that makes noise or lights up in my classroom. The necklace, please."

"The necklace?" Stephanie's hand went to her throat.

"Don't make me ask you again."

Stephanie reached back and undid the clasp, removing the necklace and placing it into her teacher's outstretched palm. He closed it and said, "See me at the end of the day to get this back."

She shook her head and went back to the test as Mr. Lombard walked back to his desk in the front corner of the room. As he sat down, he opened his "confiscated items" drawer, intending to unceremoniously drop the necklace in. Something stopped him from doing that, though. He turned the necklace over in his hands -- it looked like it was pure metal, without any way it could have lit up. He eventually shrugged and dismissed it as LEDs, or fiber optics, or something.

Still holding the necklace, Daniel Lombard looked down at the still-sealed envelope on his desk, which had been delivered to the school late yesterday -- yet another communication from his ex-wife's attorneys. Probably she wanted more alimony. She was already close to bleeding him dry -- even though that witch knew how much he made as a schoolteacher.

He sighed quietly, and looked up at the classroom full of students, heads down over their desks, pens scratching on paper. At least being a teacher had some fringe benefits for a heterosexual male in his early 40s. The kids thought he was mean for assigning seats, but he did it so he could make sure the most attractive girls in each class were in the front row. The kids thought he was mean for giving so many tests, but he did it because he found it so much easier to ogle when they were distracted, leaning over, trying to think. He unconsciously licked his lips a bit looking at Stephanie in her skimpy outfit.

Also unconsciously, he had his hands up to his neck, and he was putting the necklace on, compelled by its magic. Not accustomed to wearing jewelry, he nonetheless managed to fasten the clasp behind him. As he dropped his arms back to his sides, his first thought involved...
1112311222.title: No Need to Worry When You Have the Necklace...?

choices: A brainstorming session follows; students come up with many possibilities.
The necklace's magic goes to work; something happens unexpectedly.
11123112221.content:
Daniel saw something around his neck flash. He didn't have time to investigate any further as the door to the classroom flew open and in walked a woman in a long black dress and pointed cap, holding a broom.

He got up to confront her. "Linda, what are you doing here? This is definitely not the time to discuss anything -- and why are you in a Halloween costume?!" It was his ex-wife, dressed as a witch, complete with green skin, dark makeup, and a long and stringy black wig.

She laughed, and it turned into a cackle. "Oh, this is no Halloween costume, my dear. I thought you'd like to see the real me."

"And it's just as I've always suspected!" he exclaimed. With a wave toward his students, who were all looking up from their papers to watch the show, he said, "My class is in the middle of a test. You should have stopped by the office to get a pass. I haven't even read the letter from your lawyers I got yesterday. Why don't you just get on your broomstick and --"

Linda waved at something behind Daniel. The sound of a small explosion and several students gasping made him turn around, in time to see a miniature puff of smoke rise from the now-vacant spot on his desk where the envelope had been. He turned back to Linda, his mouth gaping a bit. She said, "I'm here because I didn't want to get the lawyers involved. I came to the realization that I'm a witch -- what do I need with alimony?" To make her point, she held out her free hand and a wrapped stack of bills appeared in it.

"Ooh..." said the impressed students.

The bills disappeared, and Linda turned her head toward the class to explain, "Actually, it draws attention if you physically create money too often. Better to just cast a spell on the bank computer system whenever you need to."

"I know you, Linda -- or I thought I did, anyway," said her ex-husband. He narrowed his eyes. "You must want something, though -- what is it?"

"Just a little fun," answered the witch, her black lips parted in a grin. "I want this class to choose how to transform you."

The class looked around excitedly. Their teacher yelled, "What?!"

"A minor physical transformation," said Linda. "Or maybe a major one. Maybe a mental component, too. Just depends on what these young men and women want."

Daniel shook his head. "I can't believe this. In the first place, they're taking a test --"

Linda waved toward the rows of desks, and everyone's test papers disappeared in a puff of smoke, just as the letter had earlier. Someone in the back of the room whooped.

The witch finally let go of her broom, leaning it against the whiteboard at the front of the room as she picked up an eraser and quickly took care of the test questions. Picking up a dry-erase marker that matched her skin, she turned back toward the class and suggested, "Let's brainstorm some ideas first, and then we'll vote, okay?"

The stunned Daniel Lombard just stood there, wondering how he had lost control of the situation.
11123112221.title: His Witch of an Ex-Wife, Now Made Literal

"Wait...could there possibly be another world beyond?!" she yells, wrapping her arms around herself "That's impossible! I'll DIE if I touch it!"

"Ah!" she gasps "Where am I?"

Stephanie was simply standing on a field of grass. As a strong breeze sent her long hair flapping in the opposite direction, she just looked around to figure out where she was. It didn't help matters that she still knew little about the necklace, which still stayed put in the bottom of her backpack the entire time.

"KONNICHIWA!" a shrill feminine voice yells.

As she rubbed on her head which now had two visible bumps, she looked up to a small girl staring at her with remorse and concern. She looked like a normal girl except her face consisted of huge eyes, a small nose and a small mouth and she had blue hair.

"Gomen nasai..." she said "I can tell you're not from around here"

Inhabiting this environment were huge-eyed children with spiky hair who enjoyed playing with weird creatures and trading cards, there were plenty high schools with pretty schoolgirls with skimpy miniskirts and perverted schoolboys, teenage boys who used swords and various magic powers, hell there were even giant robots who took the skies, flying everywhere. choices: She has dinner with her family
11123212.content:
The first place that popped into Jill's mind was her home. It was always the best place to be when things everywhere else seemed to be going wrong. Unfortunately, Jill was mistakenly thinking about her home from the time before she got the necklace. It was a little different now.

After dodging bowling ball rain, that turned into lightning and rushed back to the sky upon hitting the ground, and running across town (afraid to take the volcano bus) Jill arrived at her block. A relatively normal house stood where her house was supposed to be. She had hoped that the same old white and brown building would be there to shelter her, but compared to everything else, the new house looked safe. Jill approached the big white door, and took her key from her pocket. It clicked like usual, and Jill felt a wave of relief. She pushed the door open and jumped in.

What a jump. She fell about 6 feet into what might as well have been a lake.

"Whaa!"

Jill thrashed around hoping not to sink into the water, but luckily it was only a few feet deep. She found the solid ground below and managed to stand up. After straining a little water from her ears, she looked around. Home had changed.

"What is this?"

Her house looked like an underground cave. The walls were all rock, and there were a great number of holes all over the room, leading to who knows what. Jill's sudden comfort was now completely gone. She begged for something or someone familiar to appear.

"Mom?"

Just as the echo from her words died out, she heard something in the water. Jill turned in fright and saw something swimming towards her under the surface. She screamed and ran for a corner. However, whatever was in the water was fast. Jill found herself trapped against the wall, she feared the worst of the creature rose from the bouncing waves.

"Yes Jill, what is it?"

Jill opened her eyes and was amazed to see herself staring back from the water below.

"Did you call me, or was it one of your sisters?"

Jill replied in a confused voice.

"Mom?"

Her twin below smiled back.

"Who else? What's gotten into you? Well since everyone is here, we might as well have dinner."

Jill's twin turned around and Jill clearly saw that she had tentacles for legs The sight made Jill a little light headed.

"OK everyone, come eat!"

At that, Jill heard movement in all directions. The madness had only begun. A two headed Jill was the next person to arrive, she dropped down from one of the holes in the ceiling.

"Hi sis!" She waved at Jill, who didn't know which head to look out.

A winged Jill with a horse head then flew across the room, she neighed at everyone, and then landed near 'mom'. She was followed by a Jill who was really two Jills joined at the waist, there were not legs, just two upper bodies. Then came the crowd, a Jill with feathers, a Jill with hooves, a Jill with wheels, a robo-Jill, a Jill who was bald, a Jill with a monkey body, a Jill 2 feet tall, a Jill with eight arms, a Jill with a 12 foot tongue and lion's legs. Just about every conceivable kind of Jill was in the room. It was a little shocking for poor real Jill, to say to least. She was still leaning back on the wall, hardly able to move.

"Aren't you going to come... Oh" said the 'mom' Jill, as she began to stretch and lose her shape. Jill watched as she warped into a round ball, then began to split in two. It looked like a giant version of a cell splitting. Suddenly, the two halves fell away, and two Jills stood where there had been one.

"Looks like the family has a new sister!" Said the tentacled Jill, as she held a Jill with a cat's tail and duck bill.

Jill felt like she was about to go crazy.
11123212.title: Went home...which isn't sane.

111232121.content:
She probably would have gone crazy, but luckily she passed out first. The two hours between falling unconscious and waking up had not even registered in Jill's mind, and she awoke to a familiar sight. The very familiar chandelier like light that hung from her room's ceiling was over head. When Jill looked to her side, she saw her very own room, walls, furniture, and all.

"I'm back?" She said sitting up with enthusiastic cheer.

"Looks like it!"

The voice startled Jill.

"Sorry sis, didn't mean to scare you."

Jill looked around, her own voice was speaking to her and it was coming from no where. The windows were shut, keeping the bowling ball rain and a Bill Clinton headed, mustached, T-Rex at bay. The door was closed tight, and the TV was off.

"I'm up here!"

Jill turned to face the ceiling again, but still saw nothing. Then she looked the other way. There was a giant lizard on the ceiling, only it wasn't a lizard. Jill saw herself, complete with gecko limbs and a regular arm for a tail. The "tail" was waving at normal Jill. She was going to scream, but then said to her self "What's the point?"

"Hi, ... sis?" Jill said at her lizard counterpart, who then crawled backwards and down the wall.

"Are you OK, you scared everyone when you fell at dinner."

"Today hasn't gone as I expected. It's a like a wish gone wrong."

Lizard Jill now crawled down the wall and crossed the floor to Jill's bedside. This was a little creepy, but Jill did a good job hiding how she felt from her 'sister', who at the very least seemed to have a genuine concern for Jill.

"What happened? You've never looked this upset before."

Jill let her body fall back onto the bed, and rested a hand on her forehead above her closed eyes. She thought about Steven, and the necklace, and now regretted meddling. The new world was so unsettling, and she had no idea how she could go about fixing it without the necklace, which she just realized had disappeared some time ago. However, deep down, she also felt something being forged within her. The short time she had spent with her lizard self showed that she wasn't much different from any other person (besides the lizardness and extra arm), and in fact, Jill found her quite caring and comforting. It was almost like she could feel a sisterly bond of sorts. But she was still half lizard, and that would take getting used to.

"It's too hard to explain. I think I just need to rest."

Lizard Jill understood, and quietly backed out of the room.

Jill began to fall into a storm of thoughts, wondering what to do. She really did miss the 'real' world, if it could be called that at this point, but she also found herself becoming more and more comfortable with the new world.

"What is so enticing about crazyland?" Jill asked herself out loud. Just then, she was startled by a sound right outside the window.

Jill leaped form the bed and looked outside. It was still bowling-balling, so visibility was low. Everything past the bowling balls was shrouded in fog.

"Maybe, one just hit the window?" She turned to lay down again, but she stopped in her tracks when she saw a figure in front of her.

A person, dressed in strange black clothes was perfectly balanced on one leg, with hands together under his head. It was a ninja!

"Who are you?"

The figure laughed, but the outburst soon turned into a cough.

"Um, are you OK?" Jill reached over towards the person, but he quickly threw a pair of shuriken at the ceiling, and then jumped up, using them to hang inverted form the top of the room. His speed was superhuman, and his strength must have been as well given that he had managed to get from the floor to the ceiling with just a single jump.

"Worry not Jill, I am your guardian-wise-senior-citizen ninja, or GWSC-n for short! I have sensed your troubled mind and have come to help you through your rough times."

Jill and her GWSC-n spent the next few minutes just staring at each other - the ninja, using his nearly unlimited discipline and focus, Jill using her new found bewilderment and feelings of insanity.
111232121.title: She passes out

choices: Jill and her GWSC-n make it to the hardware store and buy shovels
1112321212.content:
"I, uh... wha?"

Jill wasn't really able to put her thoughts together. The random flailing of her arms that accompanied every unfinished syllable didn't help much.

Jill's GWSC-n merely nodded his head.

"I see."

With unbelievable speed and yet breeze like softness, he slid across the ceiling, then down the wall, and finally across the floor, until he stood directly in front of Jill. The tall ninja was still in the same stance, arms folded and legs tight together.

"You are seeking something aren't you?"

Despite the dark figure's imposing stance, Jill did not feel afraid. She somehow sensed a great deal of concern in the ninja's voice, as if he understood exactly what Jill felt.

"Yes."

Jill softly stepped forward and put her hands on the GWSC-n's arms.

"I got mad and did something I shouldn't have, and everything went wrong..."

Jill had much more to say, though it was clear from the ninja's masked face that enough had gotten across. The old man finally did away with his rigid stance, and placed his right hand on Jill's shoulder.

"I understand, Jill. I do not need to hear what was done, you've acknowledged your mistakes and are ready to fix them. As your GWSC-n, I must help."

The GWSC-n jumped back; grabbing the sword on his back and leaning forward, he struck a fierce pose.

"Jill! place your hand on the side of this blade. Let your desires leak into it, this cold steel shall mimic your soul and lead us to what is needed to set right that which was defiled!"

The sword was drawn so fast that to Jill, it seemed as if the ninja has teleported into his new position. A ringing echoed off the walls, the weapon's silver blade seemed to cry out, calling Jill over. With a quick flick of her wrist, she brushed some hair from her face and approached. Timidly, she raised her arm. The blade was frighteningly sharp, yet it exuded an aura of delicacy, as if made of thin glass. Jill looked at her GWSC-n once more, he only nodded.

A crack of thunder whipped through the room as Jill felt the sword. With every passed instant, the blade gave off more and more light, until it ceased to be physical. The crescent shaped light broke away from the hilt of the sword, and shot to the sky; the roof overhead was split open like a sheet of rock above a volcano. The beam flew higher still, and from horizon to horizon sliced through the thick clouds. In the heavens above, a magnificent symbol appeared. Manifesting itself with great radiance and a size of unimaginable magnitude, the intricately detailed figure could easily overwhelmed any who looked upon it. It began to draw itself inward and formed a great beacon which cast its light directly on the GWSC-n and Jill.

"This is it, we will now begin our journey."

The GWSC-n reached behind his back, and took out another object. It shined in the light, and Jill could not make out what it was. The ninja raised his arm into the rays that fell from heaven.

Ring, ring.

"Hello? Yes, I was the one who made a giant symbol in the sky requesting the answer to all of Jill's problems. Oh, it's over there? Thanks!"

The ninja put his cell phone away and the world returned to 'normal'.

"Well, whatever it is, it's buried at the center of the Earth. We better go get some shovels!"

Jill looked at the ninja, once again confused, then back up at the sky, only it was now covered by ceiling.

"That was a phone call?"

"Of course."

"..."

After another couple minutes of awkward silence, the GWSC-n made his move.

"No time for marveling at modern technology, we must go!"

He thrust his sword into the air and jumped after it, grabbing the hilt in an odd manner. With a loud huff, he suddenly began twirling the weapon, and hovering. He had activated his ninjacopter technique.

"Jill grab on!"

He flew back down to ground level and scooped Jill up with his free arm. The two shot up into the clouds. For a moment, Jill forgot that she was in an absolutely ludicrous world. The feeling of flying freely through the sky was simply amazing.

"This is unbelievable!"

The GWSC-n looked down.

"That's because there's no traffic, though I don't want it to sneak up on us. Jill, reach into my pocket."

Jill did as the ninja said and pulled out a white box.

"Is this what you wanted?"

"Yes, open it."

The box rattled as Jill shook it, she then turned it over and took off the lid. A robotic sounding voice spoke up.

"Make a left in 600 feet."

The ninja laughed.

"That GPS has never failed me!"

111321.content:
Okay, if you haven't played Silent Hill, here's what you need to know. If you DO know Silent Hill well, just skip this.

Spoilers ahead.

Basically, the Silent Hill cults are crazies who believe their "God" (or "The Goddess") will come and cause the apocalypse. To do this, they usually perform creepy rituals and such. Some women even have the "God" grow in them (which kills them upon birth) because of rituals. And then on birth, it is a monster that the protagonist usually kills.

But what's more creepy is Silent Hill. It's a bloody, rusty town where your nightmares become real. To you, anyways. You can end up in there by many different circumstances, sometimes randomly appearing there.

Some "monsters" include the Nurses (who stagger around in jilted motions and are nurses trying to kill you) or "Pyramid Head" (also called the Bogeyman in Homecoming). Pyramid Head symbolizes peoples' guilt. And kills them with a giant knife while wearing a pyramid on his head.

You can do more research, but I recommend playing the games.


Have fun with this, but remember if you don't like it, just make up some random plot twist to change the direction of the story.
111321.title: Quick explanation of Silent Hill stuff.

111322.content:
Read this if you want to know about Foxhound from MGS1. If not, go to the next chapter now.

Spoilers ahead too. For a lot of MGS stuff, even MGS2, MGS3 and MGS4. You've been warned.


Foxhound is a group of the elite. It has six members. They held Shadow Moses. Since they can work for a lot of people, you can have the government hire them, criminals, whatever.

List of members -

Liquid Snake - A clone who was made from Big Boss ("the world's greatest soldier"), along with Solid Snake (A badass who defeated most of Foxhound by himself...sort of, FOXDIE was involved). And Solidus Snake later (who was President George Sears). Amazing fighter, pilot and tactician, had plans to put the world in perpetual war. Was leader.

Psycho Mantis - A KGB psychic. Supposedly can read minds, but can definitley control them. And has telekinesis. And is a psycho killer. With humour. Plus, he can break the fourth wall, so use him to talk to the reader if you want. But can he see the future?

Sniper Wolf - A beautiful sniper. She is one of the best snipers ever. Period. Plus she carries huskies around with her. Those dogs are cute but will bite. So be careful.

Decoy Octopus - Master of disguise. Not much to say since he wasn't really in the game a lot (being dead and all...)

Revovler Ocelot - Master of revolvers, torture, interrogation and a manipulative jerk (though cool). Who manipulates everyone. Ocelot likes to talk to the player (or in this case, reader) in at least torture scenes.

Vulcan Raven - Shaman with a giant gatling gun. This guy enjoys the "hunt" so to speak. The hunting of you.


Some other fun stuff includes:

FOXDIE - Inject this into someone and you can choose who'll it kill. The longer the infected is near the person who should die...the less life that person has, until they die of a heart attack.

The Patriots - AI's (Artificial Intelligences) that secretly run the United States of America until the end of MGS4. Seriously.

There you go. Use them how you like.

NOTE: Metal Gear Solid breaks the fourth wall. A lot. So don't be surprised if characters "talk" to you. Or know other things that don't make sense. I'm looking at you, Revolver Ocelot. If anyone has played his infamous torture scene, you know what I'm talking about. Oh, and Psycho Mantis...he knows stuff like what games you play.
111322.title: Quick explanation of Foxhound.

choices: Jill submits to Ocelot's torture and tells him the motto.

1113221.content:
Hiding in the teacher's lounge, the unlikely pair still weren't safe. Psycho Mantis used his telekinesis to levitate into the room. Steven realized he couldn't use the necklace with Psycho Mantis around...so he hid the necklace underneath a sofa.

Psycho Mantis read Steven's mind anyways, and telekinetically tossed him through a wall. Steven fell unconcious as Jill seemed worried. By reading Steven's mind, he knew where the necklace was and took it. He turned to leave...and brainwashed Jill into coming with him.


Jill walked in a stilted fashion like a puppet, along with Mantis. They arrived at the principal's office, complete with a new "electroshock torture bed". Revolver Ocelot was spinning his guns as Sniper Wolf left the room, saying, "This disgusts me, what you want to do." Ocelot called back, "You're welcome to my shows anytime."

Mantis telekinetically put Jill in the "electroshock torture bed". Jill was resisting, but a telekinetic bump to the head, put her out cold. She was locked in place.

Mantis gave Ocelot the necklace and said, "Are you and the boss really going to use this to create eternal war?"

Ocelot replied, "Liquid Snake wants what he can't have. With this, we could take over Foxhound. We already took over this school. Imagine what we could accomplish with nations at our control. The world. We could surpass even the Patriots."

Mantis responded, "La-li-lu-le-lo?" Ocelot sighed and said, "Damn Patriots and their stupid nanomachines. Look, Mantis, you like killing?" Mantis nodded. Ocelot said, "I'll let you kill more than Liquid ever did."

Mantis nodded happily and left the room.


Ocelot then woke up Jill. Jill saw Ocelot and said, "Whatever you want, you're not getting it! Let everyone go!" Ocelot replied, "Feisty. I like that in a woman. But I have what I want. This necklace. And on top of that, I have you."

Jill looked wide-eyed in fear and then composed herself, saying, "What do you want with me?" Ocelot responded, "After much research on this necklace, it seems that one of your ancestors made it, centuries ago. The only way to use it safely is for one of your family to tell me your family motto. One of your family saying it allows me to make one wish, without any random problems. And you're that family member for now. Follow me?"

Jill responded, "This sounds like some pointless story gone wrong." Ocelot replied, "Oh the story may be pointless to the reader, but they're probably enjoying this. Aren't you?" Jill then said, "...Who are you talking to?"

Ocelot pulled a lever on the bed and Jill felt electricity surge through her. It wasn't lethal, but it hurt. And she remembered her family motto in desperation, "Never give up." Kind of ironic now.


Ocelot then said, "For this pointless but amusing story, you get to choose dear reader. Will Jill break from the electric shocks and tell me what I want to know? Or will she take the pain, allowing something to conveniently happen and help her?"

"It's..." said Jill, trying to gain a few moments. "It's..."

"Out with it, or you'll feel the full power of this 'bed' of mine." chided Ocelot.

"...Never give up...trust your instincts." finished Jill.

"So...the motto was an obscure video-game reference, just like this storyline." said Ocelot. Although now the necklace was glowing with a golden light. "Ah, now here is what we've been searching for! Though I'll keep Liquid, after all, he is still a member of our team."
