1142312112121.content:
Steven miraculously made it to the necklace, he grabbed it and lifted his body's head off the ground so he could slip it off. Before he had time to put it on, he noticed the crazed pack of screaming girls behind him. He panicked as he didn't know what to do.

"I just want this all reversed!" He screamed.

The necklace flashed, and everything went quiet. Steven had closed his eyes as he shouted, so he assumed that the lack of noise meant all was right. He quickly opened his eyes, hoping to see a normal scene, but it didn't take long for him to become disappointed.

Only one thing had changed, the pack of anime girls had become a pack of Stevens. They were all identical, all wearing the same outfit that Steven had been wearing before everything went awry. Then Steven remembered what he thought about to get out of the crazy situation - everything reversed. Instead of reversing his desire to make the world an anime fantasy, it reversed the types of people in the fantasy. The Earth had gone from a planet of anime girls trying to please Steven to a planet of Stevens trying to please an anime girl. Steven just fell back on the ground in his bikini; laying almost lifeless with his long hair all over his face, he stared up at the sky and said

"This isn't what I meant."

However, he was made a bit more uncomfortable when he became aware of the fact that he didn't possess the necklace. His eyes widened and he shot up, looking all around for it. Then he sees that
1142312112121.title: He gets the necklace

11423121121212.content:
Girl Steven sensed something odd about the Stevens around him. They didn't look quite right, and upon inspection, anime girl Steven noticed something a bit shocking. All of the Stevens had their own necklace. The otherwise friendly smiles on their faces looked rather scary to girl Steven now. He began to back away (although it wouldn't do any good as he was surrounded in all directions by Stevens).

"Hey me's, why don't you just put down those necklaces?" anime girl Steven said slowly in a trembling cute voice, backing up with her arms extended and hands open. The Stevens thought she looked very cute in her blue bikini, and found her shining black hair dazzling. It was very fortunate that the Steven army was relatively quiet, anime girl Steven could speak pretty easily. However, at least one of them was bound to think of something, especially with girl Steven's words entering their otherwise dormant minds.

Anime girl Steven suddenly felt a weight on the back of his neck, and something hanging between his breasts. He looked down and saw a necklace resting on his body, he was about to try and return the world to normal, but he noticed that it wasn't the necklace. It was just an ordinary silver necklace with a pendent. But this was only the beginning.

The Steven army saw anime girl Steven standing in her bikini and necklace, to them she looked like she was checking her looks, which were very good. The Stevens decided that they wanted to help and began thinking of ways to do so.
11423121121212.title: All 6,801,940,338 Stevens have a necklace and w...

choices: The necklace goes off on its own
Steven thinks of something to change
114231211212121.content:
Anime girl Steven tried once more to get the necklaces off the Stevens before something went wrong, again.

"Hey um, Stevens, why don't you give me your necklaces! I really like them?" anime girl Steven said, making a poor attempt at sounding mildly seductive. He started walking towards the crowd, intending to get a necklace, but he suddenly tripped. On the ground, he looked back at his feet and saw that he was wearing high heels. Furthermore, he was in a mandarin gown.

"Ahh! Stop thinking about outfits!" anime girl Steven cried out. But it was no use. Even if the Stevens around him obeyed, those farther away didn't clearly hear the command. Some began randomly thinking about good outfits for anime girls.

Anime girl Steven found this out soon enough, before he could get up, he found himself in a Japanese school uniform. He panicked, but then noticed the Stevens behind him staring.

"Hey, don't look!" He said sitting up and pushing down his skirt. Then his face looked totally confused. "Why do I even care?" He thought. "Oh no, one of me must have thought of me acting girly!"

Anime girl Steven stood up as fast as he could and made his way over to the nearest Steven. "I need to get a necklace!" He was foiled again when his outfit changed for the third time. His short skirt was replaced by a hakama and a white haori replaced his shirt. He looked just like a shrine madien, and couldn't sustain running in that guise. He began to lose his balance and stumbled off to the side, where he landed on some dirt. His formerly pristine attire was now brown and dirty.

This instantly led to him being teleported to a new location. Thought it didn't register with him at first.

"What happened?" He said with a slight headache. He looked around and found himself indoors. He felt a little warm, but at the same, he didn't feel the clothes that he was just wearing. Looking down, he found that his vision was distorted, by water. He was naked in a spa pool.

"Ahh! Get me out!"

Anime girl Steven got what he wanted, almost. He ended up laying on bad of some kind. Then he felt some hands on his back. He nearly jumped to the ceiling. Looking back, he saw one of the Stevens, with the rest of the army in line behind him, giving him a massage. This instantly freaked anime girl Steven out.

"Too creepy!" He said, but it was also lucky. The Steven giving the massage had his necklace and he was close buy. Anime girl Steven reacted quickly and managed grabbed it.

"Finally, it's time to put all of this to an end."
114231211212121.title: Wardrobe of thoughts

1142312112121211.content:
Sadly, anime girl Steven never got the chance to do anything. Before he could think, the necklace suddenly went off. Steven was getting tired of being transported all over the place; he knew it had happened again because he felt dizzy and he was suddenly sitting up on the ground and not in the bed.

"Now what happened?" He asked with a weak voice. He saw that he was in a room with a mirror. Just under the mirror was a pair of sinks.

"A bathroom?"

He walked over to the mirror rubbing his eyes, when he took a look he sighed.

"I'm in a bikini again." He said somewhat frustrated, in a voice that he would find cute under different circumstances.

His thoughts were disrupted when he heard a bang coming from the corner of the room. He turned in fright and saw a door fly open. A very young girl, perhaps only eight years old walked in wearing a pink skirt and blouse. She was holding a yardstick.

"There you are Steven! I don't know why you insist on cutting class, mine especially, but it's not happening today.

At this point Steven was totally lost. "Huh?" He said, without even noticing that the little girl was dragging him out of the bathroom. After a few minutes of walking the girl brought him to a classroom full of anime girls in bikinis and ordered him to sit.

"Oh, and I'll be taking this necklace, it's not part of the uniform." The little girl jumped up, rather high, and tossed the necklace off Steven's neck. He would complain, but he was used to things going wrong.

"You'll get it back at the end of school. If you don't cut anymore classes."

Steven sat down and the class began. It was odd to say the least. The eight year old teach was rambling on about spells and whatnot, while the rest of the class, which apparently wore bikinis as uniforms took notes. Steven was merely staring at the ceiling. At least until he was tapped on the shoulder.

He snapped out of his daze and looked over his bear shoulder. Past his silky long hair, he could see a note. He grabbed it and read it to himself.

"Spacing out even more today? ~Benjamin" Steven instantly turned around. A girl in an orange bikini and long blond hair styled with two pony tails on each side was waving back.

"Benjamin?" Steven said surprised.

The girl smiled wider and replied. "Who else sits behind you? You're really out of it today. You're lucky that you're the top magical girl in the whole school or you'd be in a lot of trouble. Are we still going to the mall later?"

Steven simply wanted to bang his head against some walls. Nothing made sense anymore.

"Yeah." He said, turning away. He'd just have to get through the very weird school and get the necklace back.
1142312112121211.title: The necklace goes off on its own

choices: Classes end, Steven takes Benjamin and looks for the necklace around school
Steven and Benjamin leave, Steven wants to learn more about this world
11423121121212111.content:
"How long is 'school' anyway?" Steven thought to himself, as the class dragged on. He couldn't even see the teacher over the students and desks in front of him. The only indication that she was even there was the unceasing squeaking of her voice. After what felt like an eternity, Steven was startled by a knocking sound.

"Alright, that's it for today. You can all head to your next class." The teach said standing on her desk, tapping the chalkboard with the yardstick which was almost as tall as she was. Steven sagged in his seat as the other bikini clad girls began to get up and chat.

"I'll see you outside Steven!" Benjamin said running to the door.

Steven realized that he was trapped in this world at least until (and hopefully not long after) the end of class and decided to just play along. As he was getting up to follow the rest of the class to wherever the next room was, he was stopped by the teacher, who had a bit of a worried look on her face.

"Steven, I know that you're a natural magical girl, but it isn't good for you to miss classes." She jumped on an adjacent desk. "Don't be overconfident. You really do still have things to learn if you want to be a successful sorceress." She smiled and reached into one of her pockets.

"I don't want to be a sorceress, not even a sorcerer." Steven thought to himself. Then he noticed the girl's hand, she was taking out the necklace.

"This looks like its important to you, but I can't let you wear it in class. Go put it in your locker, OK?"

Steven beamed, he might just be able to get out quicker than he thought. He was going to thank the teacher, but he realized that he didn't know her name. He glanced around the room quickly, then noticed a little plaque on the teachers desk. 'Master of summoning, Sir Bradley Armstrong.'

Upon reading that, Steven had to fight an urge to laugh. "Mr, no Sir! This elementary school kid is named Sir Armstrong!?"

Steven just produced a wide grin between the happiness of getting the necklace and the little girl's name. "Thanks Mr. Armstrong!" He said, and with that he grabbed the necklace and ran outside. He held the necklace up and thought intensely about the familiar world that he longed for. After waiting a bit he opened his eyes and looked around. He saw the same hallway lined with lockers and doors, and a few girls in bikinis were making their way down the hall. Steven checked himself, and surely enough he was still a black haired girl in a blue bikini.

He released a silent growl and looked at the necklace. It was shiny and silver and had a long pedant with an embedded gem. It was the non magical one he got when one of the Steven clones thought it onto him.

"But, where is the real one?"

He sighed and was about to go off somewhere to think, but the sound of bare feet running across the floor came to his ears. Steven turned around and saw the girl from before sprinting down the hall.

"Oh yeah, that's Benjamin. I think."

The girl looked at Steven, she was a little confused. "Why are you still here? Practical Skills is starting soon, you'll be late! I just forgot a book."

Before Steven could answer, Benjamin ran inside the classroom and then jumped out with a notebook.

"There we are!" She looked at Steven, "We need to go!" and grabbed his arm. The two of them ran outside where a bunch of students were standing in front of what looked like a boot camp obstacle course. Steven was so impressed that he almost forgot how uncomfortable he was in this world.

"Whoa!"

Benjamin chuckled "I can't wait to see what you do today, you're always the best to watch!"

Steven had no idea what he was talking about. Benjamin began to slow down and brought Steven to a line of students which they both joined. Everyone was watching a girl on a platform with short silver hair. She seemed pretty confident. In front of her was a pile of metal. Steven merely looked on wondering what would happen. An announcement was heard over some speakers.

"Erik, you can begin when ready."

The voice was very similar to the one the belonged to Mr. Armstrong. "Are all the teachers in this world eight year olds?" Steven whispered to himself. But he soon found something more interesting to ponder.

The girl on the platform burst into flames. The swirling fire spun all around her and went into the sky, finally settling as if it were some kind of outfit on her body. She put one foot forward and raised her hand.

"This is going to be an A! I can feel it!" She yelled.

"Showoff" Benjamin smirked, then turned to Steven "You'll do way better without trying to be flashy Steven."

But Steven was too wrapped in astonishment to converse. Erik moved her extended arm over her head, then whipped it back and forth over and over. Each time she released a glowing fire ball, one flew in every direction. Steven assumed that the metal in front of her was the target, but none of the fireballs came anywhere close to hitting them. They just went off into clouds above. However, a couple of seconds later, the fireballs returned, streaking down from the sky at extreme speed. The ground exploded when they struck. Steven began to scream when he saw a wall of fire rushing towards him, and put his hands over his face, but at the last minute he noticed that the fire stopped in front of him. Looking up and down the field, the fire stopped at a line marked on the ground. It was contained by an invisible barrier.

In an instant the fire storm vanished and Steven looked past the barrier. The metal was gone, replaced by a pool of lava. The silver haired girl bowed as the flames on her body leaped into the sky and faded.

"I'm sure even you were impressed, Steven." She shouted from the platform. Steven hardly noticed. The world was crazier than he thought.

Another announcement came up. "Result - 93.7% destruction. Native score peak: 5000 Kelvin. Grade: A-. Next sorceress, Steven."

"What?" He gulped.

"Looks like you get to make her eat her words huh?" Benjamin said, patting his friend on her back.

With many eyes on him, Steven crept over to the platform. He was a little confused. "What am I supposed to do? I don't even know what is going on!"

Erik playfully stuck out her tongue at Steven as he passed by. "A-, hear that? And I was holding back a little!"

There was a ladder at the back of platform, Steven climbed. At the top he felt a little chilly in his bikini. The wind was picking up. Downrange, he saw a giant stone wall. The field had been magically repaired and readied for Steven.

"I guess I have to break that. With my, um, magic?" He said scratching his head.

"Steven, you can begin when ready."

Steven just stood still, frozen. He had no idea what to do. He looked back down at the crowd of students watching him. Erik stood out with her silver hair, she made a yawning motion with her hand. Benjamin and a few other girls were making little waves and cheers. Steven decided to just copy Erik and hope for the best. He put his arm out.

"Hey, don't steal my pose just because you think it's cool!" Erik shouted from below.

Steven closed his eyes. He began to concentrate. Thoughts about fire filled his mind. He pretended that he was holding fire in his hands. He was so focused, he almost thought that there wan actually a fire ball in his hand, but when he peeked, there was nothing. He dropped his arms to his sides and his shoulders drooped.

"Blah, I look like a fool! Feh." Steven waved his arm in from of him and turned to go back down the ladder. But he began to lose his vision.

"Is this fog?" He began to slow down, his vision just became more and more obscure.

"Hey, everything is going white!" He stumbled around the platform feeling around for something to grab. "I can't see!"

Luckily, he spun around to face the wall. At that moment and indescribably large bolt of light erupted from where he stood. The white-blue beam was so huge, it seemed to fill the barrier that Steven stood in, rather than fly down range. No one could see inside the barrier. There was just a huge glowing cube in the middle of the field. It was continually getting brighter and also distorting. Steven was actually breaking the barrier.

"Steven stop at once!" The announcer said, but Steven was too scared to hear anything. Some of the girls on the sidelines began to run, Erik among them. As the cube began to grow more wild, a ten year old girl jumped out of no where, and summoned lightning storm over the field. The bolts of lightning pierced the cube, and it quickly shrank back into order. As it faded, Steven came into view. He was in a trance looking down at the field that he just destroyed.

"Oh. It. Works like. That." He said.

The ten year old jumped up to platform in a single leap.

"Steven, you're not usually one to show off. I thought you lost control for a second. Being sloppy will lower your grade though." She said.

Steven just looked back. "No, not me." When the girl went away he added "the one who doesn't understand magic. How did I get trapped is some strange anime?"

Benjamin was laughing below "Hahaha, you sent Erik running!"

""Result - 84.6% destruction. Native score peak: 10^16 Joules per cubic meter. Grade: B. Next sorceress, Mark."

Steven climbed down from the ladder and met Benjamin.

"I wish I had a camera to record Erik screaming! Can you do that next time?" He said laughing.

Steven looked back, still a little dazed. "I think it was a fluke, but I'll try." He then thought to himself "Well that was fun, but I need that necklace, I wonder if magical items are common in this world?"

The two went off.
11423121121212111.title: Continue with school

choices: Go off to learn more about the world...and hopefully find the necklace.
114231211212121112.content:
Steven and Benjamin decided to head to the school library, so Steven could learn more about the world he, err...she now inhabitated. At the library, Steven found an impossibly large book, labelled "The History of the World". Steven decided to open it and take a read...

"Chapter 1: The Beginning of Time.

Ever since the beginning, magical girls have existed. The magic of The First ensured our existence and when humans dared to usurp control of the world, The First turned all of humanity into magical girls, to further ensure our survival. We rapidly grew in number, even at the start of time itself (possibly started by The First), using our powerful magic that we learned from The First to create more of ourselves when necessary or the need was felt."

Steven started to think this world was more crazy than he thought, but flipped to a random page, hoping to find something that didn't disturb him as much as the possibility that humanity was swiftly changed into magical girls and may never even appear again. However, the book flipped itself back to the page he was originally at. It seemed that if he wanted to read the book, he had to read it in order. From start to finish.

Steven wasn't sure if he wanted to read the whole thing, and learn about this world's...interesting...history. Steven eventually decided to:
114231211212121112.title: Steven and Benjamin leave, Steven wants to lear...

1142312112121211122.content:
Steven sighed "Ah, there is nothing helpful in here, at least nothing that I can find. I'll have to read it later." He decided to check the book out of the library for later use.

"I'll be right back Benjamin, I'm just going to take out this book."

Benjamin leaned his head "What do you need it for? We took plenty of history last year. But OK."

Steven lugged the book over to the front desk where he was greeted with a smile by a librarian. Steven could tell that she was a student and not an "adult" because she was also a teenager. He hoped that aging was explained in the book somewhere.

"Hello, I see you've picked out a nice travel sized book!" The librarian said laughing while Steven struggled to lift it up to the desk.

"Yeah, I just found this particular book interesting."

The librarian stamped the book, and Steven began to lug it off the counter.

He dragged it all the way back to Benjamin and signaled that he was ready to go, but Benjamin found it odd that Steven was going to carry that huge book around.

"Why are you carrying that huge thing around Steven?"

"I guess I didn't think about that when I checked it out."

"That's not what I meant, why don't you just store it?" Benjamin pointed to another librarian who was putting away books that were on a cart. Instead of actually putting them on shelves or anything, she just put one hand on the top and the other on the bottom of each book, and they vanished. Steven still wasn't sure about magic, but he didn't want to stick out in this world.

"Oh yeah, silly me." With that he rested the edge of the book on a table. He took his hands and sandwiched the book, and thought about it just disappearing. He didn't know if he was doing it right at all, and he was afraid that he might destroy the book and get in trouble. Fortunately, it seemed to harmlessly poof off. Benjamin didn't say anything about it, so Steven figured he did it right.

"OK, where are we heading now? Why not the mall since we're already together?" Benjamin said.

Steven thought to himself, "I don't know how long I'm going to be here, might as well try and fit in."

"Sure Ben!" He said, in a tone more girly than he expected. The two of them left the school and set out for the mall.

They exited the school through the main doors, which were quite large. Steven was impressed with how polished they were, they were almost like two giant bars of silver.

"Wow, these are crazy doors!" Steven noticed Benjamin looking at him strangely. "I mean, they just look impressive today for some reason."

Benjamin smiled and patted Steven on the head. "I think you've been in class to long Steven!" She then pushed open the doors, revealing a surprisingly normal looking world. The stairs from the school lead down to a wide street lined with modestly tall buildings and shops. The sky was rough and gray, the rain clouds hanging above were bound to let loose soon, but they were still thin enough to let day light shine through them.

Steven was almost surprised to see something so normal, he was also grateful for it, it would make things easier if he was stuck here for long. Benjamin, who was leading, noticed Steven's more cheerful expression.

"See? Being out is already making you feel better."

Steven smiled back, but his brief moment of carefree wandering was quickly broken. It all began with an innocent rain drop.

"Huh? Was that rain?"

Benjamin turned toward the sky. "The clouds do seem..."

However, it was not rain, not water. Steven caught a drop in his palm. The pellets diving from the clouds were some form of liquid steel, a shapeless mass of restless silver.

"What is this?"

"Alan! She's back again." Benjamin jumped away from Steven; as she drifted over the ground, contrails spiraled off her body in vortexes. A powerful gust of wind pushed Steven back. When it weakened and he was able to put his hands down from his face, he saw another girl in front of a transformed Benjamin. Her hand was gliding through her long green hair and her face showed only a mischievous smile as she hovered down onto the ground.

"Hello Steven. I'm not feeling very talkative today, why don't you and your friend sit still for me?"

Steven sighed and bit his lip "Why couldn't the necklace have made it a love story?" He got ready to fight, though he still didn't really know how. He concentrated like when he was on the platform at the school, but something distracted him. There was something on his hand, he looked down and saw the metallic glob wrapping around his skin.

"Wah!"

Steven was half encased in the pellet before he even knew what was happening.

"Ha, you're really going to listen to my request?" Alan said laughing in her purple bikini. Benjamin sliced the air with her hand, sending a mini tornado towards Alan. She needed to cover herself to rescue Steven. While Alan avoided the wind, Benjamin quickly turned to face Steven. Wings of air jumped from her back, and coiled over to shred the metallic case growing around her friend.

"Don't loose focus now!"

Steven just nodded. The tense situation made it more difficult, be he was still able to summon his power.Light radiated all around him, and he became distinctly aware of the sunlight in the atmosphere. It felt good and he couldn't help but think it was a little exciting to be able to do such a thing. He put his hand out, and sent a beam of light speeding towards Alan.

She summoned a horde of metallic spheres, some of which absorbed the attack, the others came after Steven. He was quick to run, as fighting wasn't his strong suit. He couldn't keep it up though, the spheres came after him faster than he could possibly move. Again he relied upon his apparent control of light, a good number of the sphere was swatted by his quick beams, but there was an overwhelming number still closing. Steven became scared and put more force into his attacks, suddenly, beams started to shoot from the sky, and any lights that happened to be on near by. The spheres were completely destroyed. He stopped running and looked back to find Benjamin or his attacker, he didn't see anything until he heard his name called out.

"Steven, where are you?"

He looked up to see Benjamin dueling with Alan on the rooftops, wind against a flow of metallic liquid. Both fighters were keeping relatively still, launching great attacks at each while trying to deflect those head lunched on them. Steven took careful aim at the girl in purple, and was just about to fire a shot when he heard something behind him. He released the photons gathering in his hands and turned to look behind him. A rail of fire roared by like a red dragon. It was Erik.

"What's wrong Steven? Need help?"

She was obviously showing off, but Steven was glad to have any back up he could get. Alan didn't notice Erik's entrance until the fire was right on top of her. She had been preoccupied with Benjamin's wind attacks. When the heat and light became to great to ignore, she turned and saw the trail of fire streaking toward her. She tried to deflect the wind into the fire and escape, but Benjamin sent another whirlwind crashing down. Alan was hit, and fell to ground. Benjamin dived after her.

"I can't win against these numbers." Alan whispered to herself. She tossed a wave of spheres at Benjamin and the others, there were so many that the three could hardly see two feet in front of them. It only lasted a few seconds, when it stopped, Alan was gone. Benjamin sealed her powers and sighed. "They always pick the worst time. I don't know why all the cities just can't get along." Steven took it to mean that Alan was from another city, and that each city's sorceresses battled those from other cities. He made note to look it up in the book later on. As everything was winding down, Erik walked over smirking.

"Looks like this place is helpless without me." She faced Steven in particular and playfully pointed her finger at him. " I saw you running Steven, you won't be top in the school for long!"

"Give it a rest Erik, she's just not as arrogant as you, who never knows when to run for her own good," Benjamin leaned over to Steven "but you did seem a little shaky out there. You OK?"


Steven just smiled and assured Benjamin that everything was fine. If he tried explaing, Benjamin would probably think the real world was as crazy as Steven found the world that he was stuck in. He was probably the only person on Earth who knew what a boy was. He then noticed that he was a little tired from the fighting, while Benjamin didn't look worn out at all. He still tried asking, a little eager to settle down and find a chance to read more of the book or look for the necklace.

"Hey, Benjamin, are you still up for going to the mall?"
1142312112121211122.title: Go off to learn more about the world...and hope...

choices: Perhaps the necklace is closer than Steven thinks
11423121121212111222.content:
Benjamin scratched her head.

"Maybe tomorrow, getting Alan's spheres on me makes my skin crawl, I think I'm going to head home and shower five or six times. But I promise, I will go next time!"

Steven just nodded his head and watched as Benjamin flew off. He could still feel a warmth behind him, like a distant fire - Erik was looking on. Steven turned and saw her as she twirled a little ball of fire in her hand.

"What?" She said with a slightly arrogant smile. "I may have just saved the day, but I can't spend all my time hanging around my fans!"

Steven actually found the attempted insult quite relevant. Although he was supposedly a powerful magic girl, he didn't really know how to use his power yet, and random fights seemed to be fairly common in the world he was now in. With Benjamin gone, Steven thought that he might get into trouble if another fighter came looking for him. However he could try to convince Erik to tag along with him. If she went, he'd at least be able to run away from trouble as Erik would probably dive head first into a fight.

Steven summoned all the acting talent he had (almost none) and tried to look worried.

"Um, Erik, I actually need help with something. Could you come with me?"

Erik's confident face took on a less expressive, puzzled look. She obviously didn't expect this.

"What are you up to Steven?" She said leaning forward with a suspicious gaze.

"Nothing, I really just want you to come along."

The two stared for while after that as Erik thought it over. Steven was almost ready to turn and leave when she finally decided to answer.

Erik crossed her arms and looked away, "Fine, but it had better not be a waste of time."
11423121121212111222.title: No

114231211212121112222.content:
"Thanks Erik." Steven gave a smile to tried and look sincere, but Erik didn't respond, she was still wondering why her rival wanted to hang out all of a sudden.

"Um, well, I guess, let's go." Steven said, as he began walking forward only to realize he didn't know where he was going. The mall was Benjamin's idea, since she had left, Steven could try to go someplace where he was more likely to find the whereabouts of the necklace. But what place would that be?

"Well, I do have the book. I guess I'll just go to the mall and read it there while we look around." Steven mumbled to himself. He then felt a strong tug on the top of his head.

"Ahhh!"

He grabbed his head and turned around to see Erik pulling on his long strands of hair.

"Are we going anywhere?" She said in a cold voice.

Understandably, Steven felt like giving her hair a tug, but now was not the time for a cat fight. He hid his anger with a quick laugh.

"Silly me, day dreaming!"

"..."

"Anyway, I'm ready to go, but" Steven twiddled his thumbs behind his back, hoping Erik would not get mad "I lost my bearing during the fight just now. Where is the mall again?"

Steven was glad that Erik only sighed. She then walked past him.

"I didn't know that you were this hopeless on your own."

Despite Erik's saying that, Steven thought he heard a quiet giggle.

The two set off, but Erik quickly became distracted. As soon as they had rounded the corner of the block, she found a little street vendor selling all kinds of things, in particular, Erik liked the jewelry hanging down from the top of the little stand.

"Wait a minute, let me see if there is anything good over here."

Steven tilted his head "I'm glad I didn't get a girl's mind with this body." He decided to just stand in front of the stand and watch Erik try things on. However, he was soon approached by what appeared to be the shop owner; an old woman in a something like a robe came over from behind the stand.

"Hello there, why don't you take a look? You are very pretty, some jewelry would suit you."

Steven was aghast at being called 'pretty', but then he noticed something strange. He was talking to an old woman. Yet all the 'adults' he had seen so far had been kids. He became curious.

"Uh, thanks, but I'm not a jewelry kind of gu- girl. But, you have a nice stand, have you been doing this for long?"

The woman politely chuckled "Oh yes, I collect and restore lots of old or valuable items. I have for a few years now, quite a few years. It's my hobby, and I make enough to live off of it as well.

Steven began to wonder.

"Do you have any really special things?"

"Of course, one can find many wondrous things in this world if they look hard enough."

Steven's face lit up, "Maybe she's a witch or something, and can find magic" he thought to himself.

"That sounds interesting! What kind of things have you found?"

The woman smiled again and reached into her robes, taking out a small box.

"This is my favorite, I keep it to myself."

She opened the box and pulled out a dazzling necklace.

Steven practically fell over, what he was searching for had come right to him. Or so he thought.

Steven knew that necklace. It was THE necklace. Seeing it gave him shivers, and the fact that it was on someone else, who seemed rather impulsive, had him shaking in his bikini.

Erik's playful cheeriness was dropped, her haughtiness returned.

"Ah, I don't think it will fit your figure, not everyone looks like me!"

Steven began to think about jumping her for it. If he could just snatch it and change the world, he wouldn't have to worry about being pummeled. But Erik was apparently really excited about the necklace and wouldn't sit still.

"You know there is something about this necklace. It feels so good to just wear it. I think..."

"No! Do not think! Anything but that!" Steven yelled as he waved his arms at Erik.

"What are you talking about Steven? That doesn't make any sense."

Steven would tell her that the necklace had magical powers, but he feared what Erik would do with such abilities.

"Well, uh, how about we just go to the mall, which is normal. Yeah, let's do normal stuff that fills out mind with normalness!"

Erik was no longer enjoying this.

114231212211.content:
Steve and Rachel decided to buy tickets for the Astroboy movie, and they wandered around the mall before they finally saw the movie.

Astroboy was a remake of the original anime and the very first manga to come from Japan, in the 1950's. It's the story of a scientist who decides to build an extremely advanced robot after his only son, Toby, dies in a car accident. The scientist, Dr. Tenma, uses Toby's DNA and creates a copy of him and models the robot after his deceased son. However, when the robot doesn't quiet act the way Toby did, he ends up selling him to the robot circus, where the boy becomes a star performer, performing many rescues along the way and making friends with many other robots as time marches on. Astro is able to fly with rocket boosters in his legs, he has lights in his eyes and he has x-ray vision as well, along with his super-strength and super-speed. Even though the robot is small, he is almost human in many ways. Lastly, he can fire laser beams from his fingers and he even has machine guns in his butt. (This is not a movie spoiler!)

Once Steve and Rachel come out of the movie, they walk past the large display window, where they spot the large, movie poster for the Astroboy movie.

"Wow! Astro's so cool! He can do it all!" Steve cheers.

Rachel sees how Steve was totally impressed by the character from the movie. Feeling the necklace around her neck, she longed for a mighty, heroic character like Astro in her life.

"Gosh... I wish you were Astro.... and you had all his powers and abilities..." Rachel sighed.

"Huh... Oh... Hey!" Steve gasped, as he began to feel funny. His body started to change into steel, starting from his feet and working its way up!

His legs grew thicker as his skin became thick, hard metal. Inside, muscles, veins, blood and bones quickly converted to wires, metal, plastic, electronics, and engines. A power source replaced his heart, and an electrical system replaced his nerves. A computer replaces his brain, and his memory was suddenly enhanced. Hie sensed increased and his strength increased thousand-fold. Rocket-boosters were installed in his legs and his feet became retractable. His hair became pointy with the spike on top, which was Astro's trademark. Within moments, Steve had morphed into Astroboy!

"Whoa! This is great!" he cheered, as he blasted off and flew through the wide aisles of the mall, thanks to his rocket-legs. After soaring around the mall twice, he zoomed back to where Rachel was, and took her outside, carrying her with his powerful, metal arms.

"Where to, sis?"

The two girls have another wish….
1212311112122.title: Rachel and Cassandra are advanced to 20 years o...

12123111121221.title: Steve should become a 20 year old girl as well

121231112.content:
Little did Rachel know of the trouble that would soon befall her. As she walked up to the door, she is quickly grabbed from behind by an unknown individual completely covered in black. She attempts to yell for help however no one was around in the vicinity. Not even her friend from inside could hear her cries, leaving her completely alone to defend herself. Struggle as she tried, the mysterious villain was one step ahead as he took out a cloth covered in chloroform and placed it over her nose.

She gradually ceases trying to get free as she inhales the chloroform making her eventually weary, unconscious and ultimately helpless. The kidnapper is finally able to place her over his shoulder and rush off, leaving the scene.

Rachel later wakes up...
121231112.title: She was kidnapped.

choices: She realizes she still has her cell phone.
1212311122.content:
Rachel finds herself in what appears to a barely lit prison. She notices that she has been tied up (her arms tied behind her back and her legs tied together) and gagged with a thick strip of duct tape. Her clothes were tattered and very revealing as they only covered up her chest and rear areas.

"What is going on?" she thought to herself, unable to say anything intelligible due to being gagged "this isn't the kind of day I had in mind..."

She looks through the prison bars and notices other girls her age in cells who were being held hostage in a similar manner. This was very disturbing...

"I have to reach my brother" she thinks "he'll help me..."

At that moment...
1212311122.title: Alongside other teenage girls her age.

choices: A girl (from any anime/manga, comic, etc.)
12123111221.content:
At that moment, a door could be heard being opened up. The other girls bound and imprisoned in the other cells crawled to the end of their respective holding spots. Rachel, however, was curious to know why. Who were these people that were apparently feared so much?

Coming in were three henchmen. They looked like normal teenage guys but there was something unnerving about them. Crescent-shaped scars were protruding all around their bodies. They looked on at their surroundings with intimidating scowls and their smarmy grins also didn't help matters much either.

"Alright, boys" one of them said "The great boss wants one of the prisoners to meet him in the banquet halls so let's make this quick!"

"Forget that, I want to snuggle up with one of those cute girls!" another one said, wrapping his arms around myself as hearts in his eyes.

"This is the boss we're talking about, holmes" yet another one replied "We'll get our fair share in due time...don't screw anything up"

"Who is this 'boss' they're speaking of?" Rachel thinks, overhearing the conversation "Is he the one who brought me here?"

So the henchmen began walking through the prison hallways. There were at least fifty cells, each containing at least two or three teenage girls other than Rachel's cell, which was only beginning to be filled up. The scared young ladies dared to hide themselves in the darkness that their cold, unassuming prisons provided but they could be still seen from outside, their faces displaying true and unfathomable terror as the sinister henchmen pass each cell, grinning evilly.

Who were they attempting to get?
12123111221.title: Someone comes inside.

121231112212.content:
The henchmen were approaching Rachel's cell at a steady pace. She had a feeling they were looking for her but that suspicion was quickly confirmed as they had already confronted her.

"Eep!" she shrieks in her mind, moving back a little. "Stay away from me..."

"This is her" one of the henchmen said.

"Lovely! She is definitely the most beautiful girl here" another one exclaims.

"Dude, you've said that towards every other prisoner we've passed in here" the third one sighs.

"Screw you!" the second henchman growled "I can't help that all the girls here are attractive!"

"Shut up already!" the first one shouts"Let's escort her out of here now!"

"No...please...NO!!!" she thinks as the men seize her and start carrying her out of the dungeon. The other imprisoned girls just helplessly look on with tears in their eyes. It appeared that things weren't looking for poor Rachel.

Hopeless as they seemed, she fortunately had ideas already planned for this. It was just a matter of executing them properly.
121231112212.title: Rachel

12123111222.content:
Rachel squirms around for a while until she uncovers the one piece of equipment that she would've expected the kidnapper to confiscate: her cell phone. After a little more struggling, she is able to squeeze the device out of her side pants pocket. While the problem of communication was solved, she still had to be able to use it. This was a problem as she was tied up. Her mouth was also gagged which makes communicating also an issue.

This doesn't keep the intrepid young girl from trying to break free as she starts struggling to untie her binds.

Can she succeed?
12123111222.title: She realizes she still has her cell phone.

choices: Turned her into a powerful female super hero
Gives her super strength and something more
121231112221.content:
Wriggling her hands, Rachel is able to open the cell phone and knowing the keys by heart, presses the button to speed dial her brother. At the same time, Rachel had chewed just enough of the duct tape to create a small hole she hoped would be enough to communicate. Lying back on the ground she turned her head as Steven answered.

“Hello. Rachel? Where are you? What happened?

Rachel leaned forward, talking as loud as she dared.

“I don’t know. Someone kidnapped me and I’m in a cell.”

Steven gasped. “What? Um, if you don’t know where you are, maybe I could use the necklace to wish you home. If it works.”

Rachel looked around. “No! There are others here too. I can’t just leave them.”

Steven, near panic, practically cried. “Then what do you want me to do?”

Rachel thought for a moment then leaned forward. “Make me stronger. Make me strong enough to escape.”

Steven, still overwhelmed by the events, stared at the phone for a moment. “Are you sure? Shouldn’t I come and get you?”

Rachel grit her teeth. “No! Just make me really strong. Or think of one of your comic book heroes. Just make sure to give me the strength to bend steel bars.”

Steven gushed. “OK, OK. I’ll do it. But be careful. Even if this works, you don’t know anything about who kidnapped you.”

As Rachel fought back tears, she tried to remain brave. “I will. Now please do something before they come and get us.”

Steven tugged at the necklace. He would do anything to help his sister. Thinking for a moment, he nodded his head and concentrated. He didn’t want to take any chances. As he thought about giving his sister super strength, he could hear her start to moan and he tried to image what was happening.

“Is it working?”

Rachel started to feel funny as her body began to change once again from the power of the necklace. If she knew her brother, he wouldn’t go half way.


Rachel’s body tingled as she could feel her muscles grow stronger. Within moment, Rachel was able to pull on her bonds with her arms and snap the rope! She then pulled her legs apart and with a pop, ripped those bonds off too! Reaching out, she ripped off the rest of tape covering her mouth. Letting out a sigh of relief, Rachel picked up the cell phone and whispered.

As she stood up, she noticed more changes take place. Steven had.
121231112221.title: Yes, she breaks free!

Escape the cell and rescue the other captives.
1212311122211.content:
Rachel gave herself a look over, to see what Steven had done.

Her clothes, which had fit over her frame minutes earlier, were now straining from the muscle mass she gained. Her body was reminiscent of teenage fitness competitor Victoria Larvie...except with a much larger chest, she thought. Rachel flexed her arms, smiling at the strength she possessed. Her biceps ripped through her clothes and as she admired them she noticed something odd. Instead of a flesh colored ball of muscle, it was covered with blue spandex. She thrust her her voluptuous chest which caused her top to burst open, showing off a bright red "S" on the trademark yellow and red shield, answering any questions that Rachel may have had.

She removed her now ill-fitting clothes to reveal her full costume. Her blue bodysuit hugged all the curves of her body but also highlighted every super powered muscle. Her abdomen looked like it could grate cheese. Her thighs and calves were the envy of any hopeful Olympic gymnast. Rachel's hair, long, blond, and shiny, could've been in a shampoo commercial. She continued to flex her mighty muscles, lost in her thoughts of the intoxicating powers she now possessed. A slamming door snapped her back into reality as she could hear the footsteps of whom she believed to be her kidnappers. Super Rachel pondered her options.
1212311122211.title: Turned her into a powerful female super hero

12123111222112.content:
So she could escape from the cell and rescue even the other girls, who have been trapped together with her here in this dark cell.
The other girls ran away and were happy to be free now.
But now it was time for ….
12123111222112.title: Escape the cell and rescue the other captives.

Charge out of the cell and take him out

Letting out a sigh of relief, Rachel whisper into the cell phone.

“I’ve broken free from being tied up. Now I’ve got to get out of the cell and rescue the rest of the girls in here.”

Steven sighed. “OK, but be careful. Call me as soon as you get out.”

Rachel smiled weakly. “I will. And thanks big brother. And oh. Uh, just how strong did you make me anyway?”

Steven blushed, and stammered. “I, uh, thought about Thor. He’s really strong. So I concentrated on you being stronger than Thor.”

Rachel suppressed a giggle. Thor? Wow, no wonder she continued to feel as though her strength was still building. “OK, I’ll call you when I get out.”

Steven choked. “Uh wait, there’s more….” But Rachel had already hung up. He thought about calling her back, but didn’t want to give her away. He hoped she wouldn’t be disappointed with the rest of his wish.

Standing up, Rachel looked around and could see that there appeared to be at least 5 other girls, all bound and in three different cells. She was the only one alone in a cell. And just as she was about to test her strength on the bars, a guard turned the corner and seeing Rachel, quickly ran over.

“Hey you! Get away from the bars.”

Rachel grit her teeth. She could feel herself become more and more powerful. Surely she could break free and take out the guard. But what if called for back up before she could get to him? She still knew nothing about who kidnapped her or where she was. Thinking quickly, Rachel made a decision.
1212311122212.title: Gives her super strength and something more

The door opens up and reveals...
1212311122222.title: Someone is coming!

"Mmph?" Rachel moans through her gag in confusion.

Almost immediately...
12123111222221.title: The person responsible for the kidnapping.

121231112222211.title: He takes her away.

Rachel feared greatly for her safety as she continued to moan in distress through the tape strip sealed over her lips.

It did appear to be a castle from first glance though. Where it was located at, she didn't know...she just had to keep going.

Moments later, fatigue started to kick in for poor Rachel as she stopped at a nearby bookcase to rest. She knew she couldn't keep this up longer, however it wouldn't be long for the kidnapper to recapture her either.

She collapses to the ground, too weary to try and stand up. Instead, she opted to proceed on crawling like a caterpillar, hoping in vain (or just rather complete stupidity) that she could still escape either way. But she was wrong.

"Ah-ha!" A masculine voice said, seizing her off the floor "Thought you could get away!"

Even in defeat, she dared to turn her attention over to her captor but it was...
121231112222211112.title: She keeps hopping away.

She was inside what looked like the throne room. Fitting enough, she was resting on the throne, shackled and chained to it. What did the mysterious villain have in store for her?
12123111222221112.title: She is caught again.

"First things first..." the villain said "let's give you a makeover and some new clothes!"

"Humnph?" Rachel moaned in a questioning tone.

So he takes her in what seemed to be a dressing room. Somehow, he ends up dressing her in some...different attire and gave her a radically different appearance. Poor Rachel was completely helpless to stop this madness, as obvious as it already was.

"Not bad if I do say so myself..." he laughs.

Rachel just felt her heart sink low as tears flowed down from her eyes. Her new look wasn't too bad, better than wearing tatters but she felt like her dignity and humility had been stripped from her away now.

He had managed to place her in a black dress with long black stockings and black high heels. Her gorgeous blond hair had been dyed a very dark color and her skin painted pale white, not to be mention her fingernails and toenails had been polished in black. She looked like a different person!

Poor, poor dear...
1212311122222112.title: The man takes her somewhere...

The villain walks out of the room, laughing. Rachel was slightly stunned by this ultimatum but she still remained calm and determined.

"Steven will find me eventually..." she thought to herself "I cannot lose hope..."

Surely enough, her phone rang several times. Two missed calls from her brother Steven and one from her friend Cassandra. While she couldn't have answered them, it did appear that they were getting worried about her.

Hopefully, this would mean that Steven would find her eventually with the necklace...but...

After some time, a bright flashy portal appeared right in front of her. Rachel happily looks at it to see her brother Steven and best friend Cassandra jump right out of it.

"There you are, lil' sis!" Steven said, as Cassandra walked over to her, untying her and ripping off her tape gag.

However...
1212311122222122.title: Steven and Cassandra appear right in front of her!

The seperated pieces of the necklace continue to glow but they began to do something very abnormal. All of a sudden the ground starts shaking as if an earthquake started. The glow of the shards slowly enlarges and engulfs the three within it.

"You cretin! Now you've done it...!" Steven growls "we're doomed!"

"I'm sorrrrrrrrrrry....!" Rachel screamed.

12123111222221221.title: The necklace brings them home

However, nothing happens. Steven requested for the necklace to teleport them home but it didn't do anything apparently.

"Um...I'll try again..." Steven worriedly says "Necklace, please take us home!"

Again, nothing happened. Steven couldn't help scratch his head. The necklace has worked so far for everything else; but why not with this?

"I'm guessing some magical barrier is blocking any magic inside this building and the necklace's powers won't work" Rachel deducted.

The necklace reads into the minds of the three, who were thinking of their favorite heroes. It surrounds them in a radiant sphere of light as they closed her eyes, their thoughts staying pure.

For Steven, he was given a red vest, blue shorts, sandals, a scar on his left cheek, a dark shade of black on his hair and a tan on his skin. Let's not forget the trademark straw hat. Rachel could hear the other female prisoners moaning through their gags. However, there were not moans of distress or anguish. She had to see what all of the commotion was about so she peeked out of her cell and she was amazed to see a very pleasing sight.

As he turns around away from everyone's view, he slowly removes his helmet and reveals himself to be...
12123111222222.title: A knight in shining armor???

121231112222221.content:
Some of the girls were gleeful to learn their shining knight was actually Link from the famous Legend of Zelda games. Most, however, were shocked to learn that this Link wasn't the one they knew and love from the games. Nope, it wasn't the handsome young adult or his younger and cuter self. The one who had dark brown hair and said that damn annoying catchphrase for at least 29 times throughout the show's short 13-episode run. Other that that, he wasn't a bad-looking guy at all although he was sorely lacking the "pretty boy" look that his video game counterparts had.

So Link, with his trusty Master Sword, slashes open the prison bars on each of the cells and unties the girls. This continues until he frees Rachel, who was the last girl to be imprisoned.

"Um...thank you..." Rachel nervously said.
